intro: Trixis michuacana, commonly known as the Michuacan trixis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate to subtropical climates. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
